bestBHT.bht: He would undertake to make fishers of men out of fishermen, calling them to leave their worldly employments and become His disciples. Preachers are made out of laymen who are willing to leave their business for service for Christ. By following Him, they would be transformed into preachers, spreading the message of Christ to others. Just as fishermen catch fish, these disciples would be called to catch souls, recognizing the greater value and worth of humanity over mere fish. This invitation to come ye after me was a call to a life of service for Christ.

Philip Schaff: Come ye after me." A more literal rendering of the command recorded by Matthew: 'Follow me.'
To become." More strictly accurate than Matthew 4:19, hence not copied nor condensed from that account.
Archibald T. Robertson: He would undertake to make fishers of men out of fishermen.
Preachers are made out of laymen who are willing to leave their business for service for Christ.
John Gill: Leave your worldly employments, and become my disciples."
I will make you to become fishers of men."
Men, and the souls of men, are more excellent, and of more worth than fishes.
